Summary: Be a proactive team player within industry research and frequently collaborate with data science and product management. Fluent in Mandarin Chinese and English.
Description: Industry Research AnalystOffice Headquarters: Lower Manhattan, NY | U.S. Citizenship is requiredJob DescriptionAccrete is looking for a research analyst that speaks Mandarin Chinese and English fluently. This analyst also needs strong quantitative and analytic skills and a background in analyzing business models across industries. Ideally, this person will have 2 to 3 years of experience in sell-side or buy-side equity research and be proficient at building detailed financial models. This position involves two primary elements – research and validation. Our research will focus on collaboration with customers across disparate businesses in identifying areas where implementation of AI technologies would generate the most meaningful efficiencies. Validation will involve making sure that the machine outputs match the intent of the submitted ontology.The Industry Research Analyst will be responsible for providing technical guidance for the firm’s business development efforts. You will be designing bespoke machine learning solutions for the most innovative companies in the world and collaborate cross-functionally to bring these product visions to life. You will be expected to work fast and creatively to deliver compelling value for our customers.This position requires a high degree of technical knowledge and lays the foundation for a successful enterprise technology career. There is a path for significant career growth within Accrete for someone willing to learn, collaborate extensively with the team and work hard toward a common goal.Your first 3-6 monthsLearn Accrete products, technological capabilities and messagingLearn productivity tools necessary to be successfulBuild relationships with your Sales, Product, Engineering, Partnerships & Customer Success counterpartsConsistently meet goals for progressing qualified leads through the consultative pre-sales process6-18 monthsContinue to interface with Sales and Product as you design custom solutions through the pre-sales processKnow what it takes to meet or exceed your goalsInterface with Product and Project Managers to guide the technical development of the custom solutions in alignment with feedback from qualified leadsWork with mentors to set goals for yourself to gain consideration for promotionQualificationsMust be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent ResidentFluent in Mandarin Chinese and EnglishA generalist with experience in fundamental analysis and a solid grasp of important concepts and drivers that affect industries and companiesCreative and adaptive thinker when confronted with open ended and unstructured problemsStrong quantitative and analytical skills with a firm understanding of financial modelingStrong business writing skills in the form of research reports and white papersResponsibilitiesBe a proactive team player within industry research and frequently collaborate with data science and product managementThink of creative and effective use cases to test and evaluate AI solutionsResearch new industries, data sources, and AI applicationsTranslate between English and Chinese with accuracy and speedBenefits & PerksFortune 500 level core benefits package: health, dental, vision, Rx, long-term disability, short-term disability, life insurance, 401(k)Two week vacation / PTO, and all federal holidaysCompany happy hours, team bonding with bowling, tennis, and morePerformance bonuses awarded on 12 month calendar anniversary dates (cash/equity)Accrete is a fast-growing enterprise software company that is at a major inflection point after completing our Series A raise. Just four years ago, our founders combined their experience, over a decade of proprietary artificial intelligence technology and patents to start Accrete, and we were off to the races. Now our team is 50+ members strong and we have delivered major solutions to name brand companies in music/entertainment, finance, collectibles and government.Accrete is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.ApplyIf you’re the right person for the job, fill in the form below and attach a covering letter and resume. We look forward to hearing from you!

Summary: Prospective candidates will be expected to have an excellent professional and/or educational record with a strong background in physical, environmental, or data…
Description: Â :At UL, we know why we come to work.:Thousands of us around the world wake up every day with a common purpose: to make the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place. Science is in our DNA; we are endlessly curious and passionate about seeking and speaking the truth. We take delight in knowing that our work makes a meaningful contribution to society, and we are proud that our culture is centered on integrity, collaboration, inclusion and excellence. UL stands at the forefront of technological advancement, and we are continually challenged to find new ways to foster innovation and positive change. Satisfying? Yes. Exciting? Absolutely!What youâll learn & achieve::We are seeking a confident, curious scientist and programmer to fill the role of Research Scientist 3 in the company’s Grid Solutions business unit to support the Renewable Energy Forecasting Team. The ideal candidate will have a combination of meteorological and/or energy systems knowledge and programming skills to perform tasks such as developing and testing algorithms and writing software applications in support of operational forecasting systems within a real-time 24x7 data delivery environment. Prospective candidates will be expected to have an excellent professional and/or educational record with a strong background in physical, environmental, or data science, machine learning, software development, renewable energy, or engineering. The successful candidate must be able to write, modify, execute, and maintain software within a collaborative coding environment in support of internal development initiatives and client driven projects. Candidates will be expected to produce high-quality data analyses and algorithms backed by science and integrity, and provide results and assessments that can be consumed by both scientists and non-scientists. Candidates should have strong communication (spoken and written) and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Other essential qualities include working effectively with colleagues, taking the initiative, meeting deadlines, effectively managing tasks and priorities from several projects simultaneously, and having a passion for discovery.Among other roles on the Renewable Energy Forecasting Team, this position will: (a) interact with a team of meteorologists, data scientists, and programmers to develop and implement accurate and efficient approaches to operational forecasting for a variety of weather-sensitive applications; (b) create, modify, and maintain software programs to aid in the accuracy, functionality, and usability of operational forecasting systems; (c) monitor forecasted and observed weather conditions to identify hazards that may have critical impacts on client operations, and (d) participate in externally and internally funded research, development, and deployment projects. The position will report to the Forecast team’s Lead Research Scientist.What makes you a great fit::2+ years professional programming experience (preferably in a Unix/Linux environment) in one of the subject areas listed above, using a high-level language (Python preferred)Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited universityDesired (but not required) Skills:Knowledge, education, or experience in the electrical or renewable energy industryExperience with machine learning techniques and algorithms.Experience in software development teamwork and associated applications (GitHub, Bitbucket, etc.)What youâll experience working at UL::Mission: For UL, corporate and social responsibility isn’t new. Making the world a safer, more secure and sustainable place has been our business model for the last 125 years and is deeply engrained in everything we do.People: Ask any UL employee what they love most about working here, and you’ll almost always hear, “the people.” Going beyond what is possible is the standard at UL. We’re able to deliver the best because we employ the best.Interesting work: Every day is different for us here as we eagerly anticipate the next innovation that our customers’ create. We’re inspired to take on the challenge that will transform how people live, work and play. And as a global company, in many roles, you will get international experience working with colleagues around the world.Grow & achieve: We learn, work and grow together with targeted development, reward and recognition programs as well as our very own UL University that offers extensive training programs for employees at all stages, including a technical training track for applicable roles.Total Rewards: In the US, we provide lots of great benefits for our employees are their families. From Volunteer Days off to 401k match and retirement contribution benefits to flexible work location & schedule options we look to support our employees no matter what stage in life they are experiencing.Learn More::Working at UL is an exciting journey that twists and turns daily. We thrive in the twists and revel in the turns. This is our every day. This is our normal.Curious? To learn more about us and the work we do, visit UL.com

Summary: Have handled difficult customers or situations and can demonstrate resolutions. Ability to navigate data and people to find answers.
Description: IntroductionAt IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesAs a Customer Success Manager -Architect, you will apply your expert level technical skills to drive successful customer outcomes with IBM hybrid cloud & AI Growth Offerings. You will be responsible for use case identification, solution architecture design, MVP builds, and adoption of our Growth Offerings that run on Red Hat OpenShift. You will also guide IT executives through the changes needed to unlock the full value of hybrid cloud, show users how to get value out of their solutions, identify expansion opportunities, and work with the renewal team to ensure execution of the renewal process.To be successful in this role you:Demonstrate a history of success as a consultant, pre-sales, technical account management, enterprise architect, or equivalentDeeply understand customer business and technology needs; become the face of IBM to the customerServe as a trusted technical expert for the customer’s cloud migration, deployment, and adoption of Hybrid Cloud & AI Growth OfferingsHave a proven track record of leading technical conversations and persuading others to take action based on requirements and value provided by solutionsHave handled difficult customers or situations and can demonstrate resolutionsWillingness to take initiative and tackle things on your ownAbility to navigate data and people to find answersExecute customer success plan to drive adoption post-deploymentIBMReferred_NorthAmericaRequired Technical and Professional ExpertiseTechnical ArchitectureContainersCloud ComputingDevOpsMicroservicesPreferred Technical and Professional ExpertiseN/AAbout Business UnitIBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.IBM's award-winning global commitment to inclusivity is underpinned by our culture of flexibility. We can offer a variety of ways to support IBMers with balancing work and life through flexible schedules or work arrangements where possible. IBMers cite that our flexible work culture positively impacts their experience at IBM.IBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:+ 12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.+ World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.+ Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.+ Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).+ Select educational reimbursement opportunities.+ Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.+ Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.+ Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.Location StatementIBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).Select educational reimbursement opportunities.Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.This position is eligible for participation in an IBM sales incentive plan. Actual incentive opportunity will be based on performance and the eligible Target Incentive, as addressed in the applicable plan, all of which is subject to change.We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Summary: A bachelor's degree in business, marketing, healthcare or life sciences or equivalent experiences. Relevate+Arteric has deep understanding and expertise in data…
Description: Product Manager KOL Network DevelopmentOverviewRelevate+Arteric is a fast growing, award-winning, digital healthcare agency driven by exceptional people and a unified set of core values. We provide intelligent solutions across the digital ecosystem, delivering meaningful experiences and engaging customers across the healthcare spectrum. Our mission is to explore the boundaries of the possible and create life-changing experiences through feature-rich, defect-free deliverables that work everywhere and every time. We do this every day by connecting patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers to the information patients need to live longer, healthier lives.Relevate+Arteric has deep understanding and expertise in data science & analytics, performance-based brand strategy & digital marketing, creative experience-based innovations, and digital asset design & development. Relevate+Arteric continually delivers measurable results, drama-free, for our pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device blockbuster brands throughout the brand lifecycle.Position Summary: The KOL Network Development product manager is a position, focused on building, extending and commercializing relationships with Key Opinion Leaders for the Relevate product portfolios with a strong emphasis on pharmaceutical therapeutic areas of Interest to Relevate clients. The main targets are to define and execute on a KOL network strategy with the intent to gain mind- and market share for brands in the specified therapeutic areas. The ideal candidate is an experienced marketer of highly technical and clinical products and demonstrates strength in product management, product launches and commercialization, and demonstrates a high level of business acumen, while successfully building relationships with high profile customers. Additionally, this candidate will have strong experience and understanding of compliance, legal and regulatory requirements with a proven ability to flourish in a cross-functional team leading as a direct or in-direct manager or expert.This is an opportunity to join a new product-led organization. We are a growing team, supporting the company’s priority of creating innovative marketing solutions for life science and healthcare companies.Areas of Responsibility: Understand Relevate’s overall strategic vision and translate this into specific goals for our brand and commerce organizations. Exemplify Relevate’s core values: Caring, Accountable, Proactive, Positive. Develop a comprehensive strategy for KOL engagement and their commercialization to help gain market share for Relevate Clients’ products. This includes creating transparency about who are the KOLs across pharmaceutical therapeutic areas, developing an engagement plan on how to advance mindshare with these customers and make them ultimately client brand advocates. Maintain and build close relationships with KOL accounts (this also includes national and local IDN’s and Pharmaceutical Manufacturers) as the main point of contact to the Relevate Business to ensure marketing strategy and plans are aligned and implemented into the KOL relationships and reference sites. Partner with product marketing and marcom to activate successful campaigns that generate qualified leads, expand market share and retain customers by leveraging KOL insights and driving reference site usage. Carry out clinical marketing studies with KOLs to further develop, strengthen and deliver proof to our unique value propositions for Relevate applications. Create - in close collaboration with Relevate’s product marketing and marcom - sales and marketing collaterals with our KOLs such as white papers, customer quotes for sales presentations and articles in internal and external journals and engagements. Support Relevate’s Client Development/Client Partnership Operations group with defining and executing on a reference site strategy which is geared to increase the overall win-rate. Manage reference sites for customer visits from contract negotiations, visit strategy and execution, metrics and reporting, payment and resource scheduling. Educate Client Development and Client Services on the unique value propositions in utilizing KOL resources and assets for the brands we serve.Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities Passion for marketing, helping people in the life sciences and healthcare industry digitally transform – think technology and automation first! Strong customer-centricity, customer empathy. Excellent judgment and thoughtfulness about the dynamics of a product ecosystem where all our technology systems are interconnected in real-time. Detail oriented with superior organizational skills - balancing multiple projects, deadlines, and requests should be second nature to you. Be able to define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products. Ability to work independently with being given clearly defined goals, with full ownership and responsibility for discovering the path to achieve those goals. Ability to make decisions and communicate clearly, both verbally and in communication tools and applications -roadmaps, priorities, and experiments across a wide spectrum of audiences from executive stakeholders to partners along with colleagues. Ability to see the non-obvious; the creativity and confidence to eschew "conventional wisdom." Ability to succeed in a constantly changing, fast-paced environment. Ability to conceptualize, manage, and prioritize multiple projects for stakeholders. Ability to work well with others.Education/Experience Requirements 3-5+ years of industry experience in marketing, product management, product design or equivalent consulting experience. A bachelor's degree in business, marketing, healthcare or life sciences or equivalent experiences. Experience leading post-launch optimizations. Experience with marketing, personalization and advertising technologies (Google Analytics, Facebook Ads, Google Ads, Salesfusion, etc.) Experience with MarTech stacks, including the technical systems, operational and marketing processes that create user and business value, in order to clearly communicate the desired outcome of MarTech product work. Digital Marketing Certificate, preferred MBA preferredWhy Should You Apply?Be a part of a compassionate, driven team that treats you like family and emphasizes open communication through our CORE VALUES of Proactivity, Positivity, Accountability and Caring.Be a part of our FUN! Team Impact - Bringing our colleagues together to think outside the box and implement ingenious activities to involve, inspire, and facilitate positivity and caring. Team HOPE - seeks out philanthropic opportunities so that we can proactively care, respect, help, serve, and grow.Relevate has been finalist in 2018 & 2020 for Cincinnati Business Courier Best Places to WORK2021 Cincinnati Enquirer Top Place to Work

Summary: We're looking for experienced full stack engineers to join our Insights team to enable Heap's customers to understand and take action on their data.
Description: Heap's mission is to power business decisions with truth. We're building infrastructure to automatically capture customer interactions on web and mobile applications, make sense of them, and make them actionable for anyone. We want to enable everyone to understand their millionth customer as well as they understood their first.We're looking for experienced full stack engineers to join our Insights team to enable Heap's customers to understand and take action on their data. The team spans everything from frontend UX and visualizations to the backend SQL query engine, and works closely with the Data Science team to translate new analysis concepts into user-facing features. On this team, you'll work cross-functionally with engineers, designers, and product managers to understand our customers and bring new analysis features to market. This is a quickly-growing product area with a huge opportunity to impact the business and play a pivotal role in Heap's success.We're a distributed team that operates within US time zones. The larger Heap engineering team has members in Europe and Australia as well. For this position, we're looking for remote engineers in time zones that overlap with the contiguous US, including North America and South America.What we're buildingAdvanced analysis and visualization tools. Some of the best insights from your data come from places you don't expect. Working with our Data Science team, we're building new tools that surface proactive insights from your data and suggest paths for further analysis.Easier-to-use analysis modules . Building Heap is as much a design problem as anything else. The most powerful analytics infrastructure in the world doesn't matter if our users can't access that power and understand the results. We're revamping some of our core analysis modules to provide a better user experience and make it easier for anyone to use Heap to understand user behavior.Reusable component library and design system . Working with other frontend-facing product teams, we're building a reusable component library and design system that can be used across all Heap product teams.For this team, you'll work primarily with Node.js, React, TypeScript, and PostgreSQL. Under the hood, Heap also uses Golang, Scala, Spark, Kafka, and Redis, plus Objective-C, Swift, Java, and Kotlin SDKs. For more about our architecture, check out Virtual Events: Making Data-Driven Decisions a Reality .What we're looking forA collaborative and intellectually curious approach to software development. You enjoy learning from and teaching others, and aren't afraid of asking lots of questions.Excellent communication skills, particularly in writing. We're a distributed team all over the world, so we pride ourselves on our ability to communicate complex ideas clearly in writing across the team.Experience across the stack with any modern web framework. Familiarity with parts of our stack is a plus (React, Node.js, TypeScript, PostgreSQL).Experience with unit, integration, and end-to-end testing.Experience building and shipping web apps in a cross-functional team, working with design and product. For this role, we're looking for 3+ years of relevant web development experience.We aren't expecting you to know everything! One of our core values is "Emphasize Slope Over Y-Intercept," so we are always looking for candidates eager to learn new technologies.People are what make Heap awesome. Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive equal opportunity workplace everyone can call home.Heap has raised $95M in funding from NEA, Y Combinator, Menlo Ventures, SVAngel, Sam Altman, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian, Harj Taggar, Ram Shriram, and others. We offer plenty of awesome benefits , and we were named #1 on Glassdoor's Best Places to Work (SMB) . We'd love to hear from you!#LI-YG1

Summary: Pilot and scale advanced analytics tools and data science to drive growth. B2B and life science experience a plus. Must be proficient in SQL.
Description: Are you passionate about data and analytics? Do you believe that digital and data driven marketing is the future and excited to be part of this transformation?We are looking for a senior manager of marketing analytics that understands data strategy, drives our analytics roadmap development, and helps organizations transform. The manager is versed in industry-leading analytics technologies and is business-results and ROI obsessed. As the senior manager for marketing analytics, you will be responsible for developing and translating the overall analytics vision into strategy and roadmap to drive business performance and growth. You will be responsible for both directing other analysts and data scientists, as well as rolling up your sleeves to produce reports and analysis.Thermo Fisher is a fast-moving company with continual acquisitions, contributing to some compromises in end-to-end analytics. We need a leader that can help us rise above, connecting data sources and information for meaningful insights. We need a leader that can craft a strategic analytics roadmap to guide us, look holistically across all touch points, refine, and optimize. The journey will be taxing. You must be comfortable with flexing as needed as we develop and refine our models. Ideally, you’d have experience leading and transforming marketing analytics with data architecture strategy and advanced analytics technologies/applications.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop strategic roadmap for marketing and web analytics vision to drive marketing performance and prepare for advanced applicationsIdentifies analytics gaps and recommends improvements for more robust data and processesDefine and deploy analytics infrastructure to support marketing operations, including IT requirements and implementationEstablish data visualization and reporting tools to enable actionable insights for business units and regionsPilot and scale advanced analytics tools and data science to drive growthPerforms other duties as assignedQualificationsBachelor's degree in a relevant field; Master's degree preferred6+ years of analytics experience working with marketing/sales teamsDeep understanding of media landscape, site analytics, attribution and CRM systems for holistic marketing ROIExpertise in mining, transforming, and analyzing large, complex data sets yielding opportunities for revenue and/or process improvementMust be proficient in SQLDigital analytics experience using Adobe Analytics preferredAbility to translate strategy into projects and drive project executionProficiency in data analytics, experience BI/analytics toolsExperience leading/working in agile structure teamsExceptional verbal/written communication skillsAble to build relationships with key individuals necessary for collaborationDevelop and present communications, frequently to senior leadership, communicating the desired message, at the appropriate level, for the right recipientB2B and life science experience a plus

Summary: Bachelor’s degree in life sciences, other sciences, technology, engineering or related fields. Understanding of biostatistics concepts preferred; strong prior…
Description: JOB DESCRIPTIONJoin us on our exciting journey! IQVIA™ is The Human Data Science Company™, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics, and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.PURPOSEThe AI/ML Solutions Director role is a new strategic position within the Biostatistics and Decision Sciences business focused on applying innovative AI/ML solutions based on SOMS platform to uncover insights in clinical trial as well as real-world data, enabling precision medicine in healthcare. SOMS is a next-generation ML platform that focusses on deriving insights from multiple data sources.RESPONSIBILITIESThe SOMS AI/ML Solutions Director position will report to the Principal of SOMS Product and will be responsible for the following:Lead global sales-support function of the SOMS product for the assigned vertical, ensuring all sales goals are fulfilled, revenue and profitability targets are met while keeping expenses within budget.Lead development direction of product, and integration with other offerings in IQVIAApproximately 40 - 70 proposal engagements totaling an annual budget of $10 - $20 M.Global travel as and when required.Should be comfortable with consultative selling, building client relationships, leading and supporting sales efforts, leading meetings and delivering presentations and proposals.Must be able to “whiteboard” and consult with a client to determine areas of opportunity across our portfolio of services including SOMS.This person is expected to perform a variety of tasks where a wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.Must be able to synthesize complex business problems and create and articulate potential solutions in a simple and easy to understand narrative.Develop and deliver client facing sales presentations at the C-suite Executives.Develop and maintain a qualified long-term sales pipeline.Provide qualitative and quantitative pipeline reporting and monthly updates on sales status to the SOMS executive oversight team.Serve as a primary client contact for software and key consulting sales to ensure appropriate communication channels are maintained.Partner with Consulting Services Account Leads, Clinical Trial, Real-World, Software Sales and Commercial Business Development partners to generate and qualify software and consulting leads, meet prospective clients, develop and submit proposals, and close deals.Take up sales support responsibility for additional products, services and solutions as necessary.Work with other IQVIA Business Development functions to ensure proper and efficient integration of SOMS into clinical trial and real-world sales and RFP response processes.Partner as needed with global functions supporting the SOMS business including Marketing, Consulting, Finance, Contracting, Legal, HR, and IT.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESGeneralAbility to internalize technical capabilities and business applications.Work strategically towards realizing and prioritizing prospective customers.Demonstrated strong program management skills and ability to work through others to deliver timely and high-quality results.Experience working proactively in a pressurized environment and managing competing priorities.Highly effective team leadership, mentoring, and training skills, fostering learning and knowledge sharing with colleagues.Maintains a positive outlook at work; handles criticism well and learns from it.Excellent organization and problem-solving/analytical skills.Sound judgment and decision-making skills.Excellent written and oral communication/presentation skillsAct with a sense of urgency, and be able to lead a team.Strong influencing and negotiating skills.Excellent interpersonal/customer service skills.Ability to understand customer needs, have difficult conversations with stakeholders and customers, and negotiate solutions.Excellent software and computer skills, including MS Office applications.Specific Technical Skills and ExperienceUnderstanding of overall drug/med-device development process required.Understanding and experience with clinical and commercial development processes, including familiarity with trial design and biostatistics processes.Prior experience with software and solution sales support desired.Understanding of biostatistics concepts preferred; strong prior academic or on the job experience is a plus.Familiarity with IQVIA business units/functions and ability to navigate the organization effectively is a plus.MINIMUM REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEBachelor’s degree in life sciences, other sciences, technology, engineering or related fields.Advanced degree preferred, preferably MBA, but will consider PhD/other Master’s degree with appropriate combination of experience.10+ years’ work experience in consultative selling, selling and delivering software products and solutions, managing multi-Line Of Business (LOB), and multi-discipline pursuits, negotiation skills on large deals, written and oral communication skills including proposal writing and presentation material development and delivery.Good understanding of Pharmaceutical and/or Technology industry and eco-system around it.At IQVIA, we believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. The advanced analytics, technology solutions and contract research services we provide to the life sciences industry are made possible by our 70,000+ employees around the world who apply their insight, curiosity and intellectual courage every step of the way. Learn more at jobs.iqvia.com.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable law.IQVIA, Inc. provides reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Applicants who require reasonable accommodation to submit an application for employment or otherwise participate in the application process should contact IQVIA’s Talent Acquisition team at workday_recruiting@iqvia.com to arrange for such an accommodation.

Summary: Strong hands on technical Big Data SQL, Python / R or equivalent data wrangling and reporting experience with multi-billion daily row volume data sets.
Description: Senior Product AnalystSan Francisco, CA or Remote (west coast hours)Rapidly growing start-up, one of Apple’s top free apps with over 25 Million active users and $200 Million in equity financing, is looking for a savvy Data Analyst to join our growing Data, Analytics, and Data Science (DAS) team. As a senior member of the team, you will partner with product managers to understand, report, and optimize a robust product analytics roadmap that fuesls growth new business opportunities, and finds incremental value for the organization. The candidate will leverage their analytic and technical talents and our unique dataset of geolocation, mobile application, and transaction data to help answer key business driver and product efficacy questions and deliver analytic programs and strategic insights projects.The ideal candidate has a passion for product experiences, the customer journey, fueling the business with meaningful data driven insights, and distilling results into a compelling narrative. Utilizing a blend of product strategy, technical data skills, and analytics techniques, the candidate should be able to answer a range of business questions and present the insights in a concise and effective manner. The candidate must bring a blend of consulting, collaboration, technical aptitude, leadership, programming skills, as well as business skills to be effective in this role.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIESBuild a holistic understanding of our product, customers, data, product and business goals to create and deliver analytic insights..Analyze and deliver insights and recommendations utilizing complex, large volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.Understand business drivers and performance trends as well as answer product and business questions to drive product actions.Leverage industry best practices in establishing repeatable Business Intelligence capabilities and experiences.Proactively foster and drive a data driven analytics culture.Look for new opportunities to leverage data assets in innovative waysBe an analytics thought leader and evangelist to create and drive the Life360 Data and Analytics brand both internally and externally.EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS5+ years of data analytics experience (Consumer internet, mobile app, or digital product experience preferred)3+ Years in data and analytics consultative capacity as an engagement and delivery lead role.Demonstrated experience in program and project delivery evolving translation of strategic business and product questions into a successful data and analytics roadmap.Strong hands on technical Big Data SQL, Python / R or equivalent data wrangling and reporting experience with multi-billion daily row volume data sets.Proven experience in delivering enterprise Data and Business Intelligence projects (Tableau, Qlick, Looker, or equivalent)Ability to work with Product Managers to create an analytic vision, deliver insights, and hypothesize on new opportunities.Keen grasp of statistical concepts and product testing execution (confidence intervals, hypothesis testing, regression models)Proven hands on expertise in leveraging big data and cloud database technologies (AWS, Athena, Redshift, Snowflake, Hive, Teradata)Team development and leadership experience preferredDemonstrated project management and organizational skills.Excellent verbal and written communication skillsDegree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.PERKS100% remote (work West Coast hours)Free snacks, drinks, and food in the officeHealth, dental and vision insurance plans401k plan$200/month Quality of Life perkA great office with plenty of light in the heart of the SOMA district in beautiful San FranciscoWe do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any legally protected status.Job Type:
